note.body:
You have, essentially, the same ```configure``` as me.  Lots of white-space diffs and two irrelevant diffs relating to help files.

The ```configure``` from the tarball is different, but not in interesting ways.  (Such as using ```$FILE``` instead of ```/usr/bin/file``` directly.  Ditto ```sed```.)

target_title: Cells range not outlined anymore when entering formulas

note.body: It's in ```src/widgets/gnm-expr-entry.c```.  Function ```gnm_expr_entry_colour_ranges``` and others.

note.body:
When the problem happened, I had only HEAD in `/usr/local`. \
Now I tried to uninstall all the other versions in `/usr/local` and the problem still happens. \
The only thing I see is the `configure` provided in the tarball that could be different from the `configure` I generated with `autogen.sh`.

target_title: Cells range not outlined anymore when entering formulas

note.body:
I don't know what to do here.  I don't actually think there is a problem with the source code, but I realize that's not a lot of help for you.

Try making sure you have only one version present in ```/usr/local```.  I'm fairly certain that old executables can use new libraries, but not the other way around.

target_title: Cells range not outlined anymore when entering formulas

The only thing that's different there is the version of libspreadsheet (part of the gnumeric install) being used 57 vs. 58.

With the link above (https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnumeric/-/tree/a6dc0c3845d8d698b98c710361cd59c487285378), why are you getting 58?  Or is that with HEAD?

Also, try making sure only one version is installed in /usr/local at any time.

UI: marking active / focussed cell  by 'bordering' partly lost when autofilter active or rows hidden,

note.body: confirm autofilter test now healed too   :-) :-) :-)

target_title: UI: marking active / focussed cell  by 'bordering' partly lost when autofilter active or rows hidden,
UI: marking active / focussed cell  by 'bordering' partly lost when autofilter active or rows hidden,

note.body:
[edit] Some salt in the soup ... the error with row_hide_check_2a.xml  
seems to be fixed, the error with autofilter_test_3.gnumeric  
still occurs as reported in https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnumeric/-/issues/712#note_1783923  
:-(  [/edit]  

first glance says ok, :-)  . tested in bin64, bin80 and Dec64.  
Dec64 seems faster than before, bin. ver. a little slower,  
  
As gnumeric uses cairo it's evtl. near to this problem:  
['An Emacs-Cairo Scrolling Bug due to Floating-Point Inaccuracy'](https://www.ac.uma.es/arith2024/papers/An%20Emacs-Cairo%20Scrolling%20Bug%20Due%20to%20Floating-Point%20Inaccuracy.pdf) ,  
if not, the article is interesting to read anyway, despite I won't  
consider it a floating-point problem, it's a problem of fractional  
vs. 'fixed root' mathmatics.

target_title: compatibility problem reg. precision when storing double values. (long doubles also affected)

note.body:
have worked with GNM_SHORTREP_FILES=1 since it's implemented,  
the double -> long double compatibility problem is solved,  
and I haven't seen any issues with the option.  
Did enough others test it that we can make it default?

target_title: Restore mathematical logic for rounding down and up,

note.body:
as we are pretty near to 'math' with the improvements in #770,  
I'd like to ping here. Can we have a patch to make 'fake_' optional?  
If it's the right way to steer with an environment setting like in  
#598 I can try to clone that patch. Would 'GNM_SHARP_ROUNDING'  
be appropriate?  
Would also solve #673 .

target_title: Darkmode makes buttons unreadable

note.body: I had the same issue, solved by changing icon set. I am using Papirus icons and when I had Papirus set as icon set then icons was dark and unreadable but then I changed to ePapirus-dark and it's normal now. If I select Papirus dark icons set then icons are white but cross pointer is white too but ePapirus-dark solves both issues. Running Gnumeric on Hyprland.

target_title: Mouse cursor completely white and invisible

note.body:
I had the same issue, solved by changing icon set.
I am using Papirus icons and when I had Papirus or Papirus dark set as icon set then cursor was white like that but then I changed to ePapirus-dark and it's normal now. Running Gnumeric on Hyprland.

target_title: MATH: rounding functions: cover full range of operands.

note.body:
hello @ Morten,  
  
seen late, you invested more work here, appreciate it,  :smiley:  :thumbsup: 
  
re-checked:  
>> What is the benefit of 'fake\_' in Dec64?????  
  
> Same as in binary64. Do =1/3\*3 and you have 0.9999999999999999. It's a problem of finite-precision   
> math, not the base as such.  
  
``` 
'=  trunc( 1 / 3 * 3, 16 )' ->  0.9999999999999999,  
'=roundup( 1 / 3 * 3, 16 )' ->  0.9999999999999999,  
'=  round( 1 / 3 * 3, 16 )' ->  0.9999999999999999,  
no changes, rounding behind representation, 
``` 
 
``` 
'=  trunc( 1 / 3 * 3, 15 )' ->  0.999999999999999,  
'=roundup( 1 / 3 * 3, 15 )' ->  1.0,  
'=  round( 1 / 3 * 3, 15 )' ->  1.0,  
changes, but would work same without 'fake'?  
```
